verses.kjv: And Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of the LORD at Jerusalem, to keep the passover unto the LORD God of Israel.
verses.web: Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to LORD’s house at Jerusalem, to keep the Passover to LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: Hezekiah sent messengers throughout all Israel and Judah, and also wrote letters to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh, inviting everyone to come to the LORD's temple in Jerusalem to celebrate the Passover to the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: For the king had taken counsel, and his princes, and all the congregation in Jerusalem, to keep the passover in the second month.
verses.web: For the king had taken counsel with his princes and all the assembly in Jerusalem to keep the Passover in the second month.
verses.ct: The king had consulted with his officials and the entire assembly in Jerusalem, and they decided to celebrate the Passover in the 2nd month.

verses.kjv: For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.
verses.web: For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves in sufficient number, and the people had not gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: They couldn't hold it at the normal time because not enough priests had consecrated themselves, and the people hadn't yet gathered in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the thing pleased the king and all the congregation.
verses.web: The thing was right in the eyes of the king and of all the assembly.
verses.ct: The plan seemed right to the king and the whole assembly.

verses.kjv: So they established a decree to make proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beersheba even to Dan, that they should come to keep the passover unto the LORD God of Israel at Jerusalem: for they had not done it of a long time in such sort as it was written.
verses.web: So they established a decree to make proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beersheba even to Dan, that they should come to keep the Passover to LORD, the God of Israel, at Jerusalem, for they had not kept it in great numbers in the way it is written.
verses.ct: So they issued an official decree and sent it throughout all Israel, from Beersheba in the south to Dan in the north, calling everyone to come celebrate the Passover to the LORD, the God of Israel, in Jerusalem. It had been a long time since the nation had celebrated it the way Scripture required.

verses.kjv: So the posts went with the letters from the king and his princes throughout all Israel and Judah, and according to the commandment of the king, saying, Ye children of Israel, turn again unto the LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and he will return to the remnant of you, that are escaped out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.
verses.web: So the couriers went with the letters from the king and his princes throughout all Israel and Judah, and according to the commandment of the king, saying, “You children of Israel, turn again to LORD, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, that he may return to the remnant of you that have escaped out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.
verses.ct: Couriers carried letters from the king and his officials throughout all Israel and Judah. The king's message read: "People of Israel, return to the LORD, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, and he will return to those of you who survived and escaped the grip of the kings of Assyria.

verses.kjv: And be not ye like your fathers, and like your brethren, which trespassed against the LORD God of their fathers, who therefore gave them up to desolation, as ye see.
verses.web: Don’t be like your fathers and like your brothers, who trespassed against LORD, the God of their fathers, so that he gave them up to desolation, as you see.
verses.ct: Don't be like your fathers and your brothers who were unfaithful to the LORD, the God of their ancestors. He handed them over to devastation, as you can see for yourselves.

verses.kjv: Now be ye not stiffnecked, as your fathers were, but yield yourselves unto the LORD, and enter into his sanctuary, which he hath sanctified for ever: and serve the LORD your God, that the fierceness of his wrath may turn away from you.
verses.web: Now don’t be stiff-necked, as your fathers were, but yield yourselves to LORD, and enter into his sanctuary, which he has sanctified forever, and serve LORD your God, that his fierce anger may turn away from you.
verses.ct: Don't be stubborn like your ancestors were. Submit yourselves to the LORD and come to his sanctuary, which he has set apart forever. Serve the LORD your God so that his fierce anger will turn away from you.

verses.kjv: For if ye turn again unto the LORD, your brethren and your children shall find compassion before them that lead them captive, so that they shall come again into this land: for the LORD your God is gracious and merciful, and will not turn away his face from you, if ye return unto him.
verses.web: For if you turn again to LORD, your brothers and your children will find compassion before those who led them captive, and will come again into this land, because LORD your God is gracious and merciful, and will not turn away his face from you, if you return to him.”
verses.ct: If you return to the LORD, those who captured your brothers and your children will show them mercy, and they'll be allowed to come back to this land. The LORD your God is gracious and merciful, and he won't turn his face away from you if you return to him."

verses.kjv: So the posts passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh even unto Zebulun: but they laughed them to scorn, and mocked them.
verses.web: So the couriers passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, even to Zebulun, but people ridiculed them and mocked them.
verses.ct: The couriers traveled from city to city through the territory of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the way to Zebulun, but most people ridiculed and mocked them.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless divers of Asher and Manasseh and of Zebulun humbled themselves, and came to Jerusalem.
verses.web: Nevertheless some men of Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun humbled themselves, and came to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Even so, some people from Asher, Manasseh, and Zebulun humbled themselves and made the journey to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Also in Judah the hand of God was to give them one heart to do the commandment of the king and of the princes, by the word of the LORD.
verses.web: Also the hand of God came on Judah to give them one heart, to do the commandment of the king and of the princes by LORD’s word.
verses.ct: In Judah, the hand of God moved the people to be united in obeying the command of the king and his officials, which was in line with the word of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And there assembled at Jerusalem much people to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great congregation.
verses.web: Many people assembled at Jerusalem to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great assembly.
verses.ct: A massive crowd assembled in Jerusalem to celebrate the Festival of Unleavened Bread in the 2nd month — an enormous gathering.

verses.kjv: And they arose and took away the altars that were in Jerusalem, and all the altars for incense took they away, and cast them into the brook Kidron.
verses.web: They arose and took away the altars that were in Jerusalem, and they took away all the altars for incense and threw them into the brook Kidron.
verses.ct: They got to work removing the pagan altars throughout Jerusalem, tearing down every incense altar and throwing them all into the Kidron Valley.

verses.kjv: Then they killed the passover on the fourteenth day of the second month: and the priests and the Levites were ashamed, and sanctified themselves, and brought in the burnt offerings into the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Then they killed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the second month. The priests and the Levites were ashamed, and sanctified themselves, and brought burnt offerings into LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Then they slaughtered the Passover lambs on the 14th day of the 2nd month. The priests and Levites were ashamed of their lack of preparation, so they consecrated themselves and brought burnt offerings into the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And they stood in their place after their manner, according to the law of Moses the man of God: the priests sprinkled the blood, which they received of the hand of the Levites.
verses.web: They stood in their place after their order, according to the law of Moses the man of God. The priests sprinkled the blood which they received of the hand of the Levites.
verses.ct: They took their assigned positions according to the Law of Moses, the man of God. The priests sprinkled the blood that the Levites handed to them.

verses.kjv: For there were many in the congregation that were not sanctified: therefore the Levites had the charge of the killing of the passovers for every one that was not clean, to sanctify them unto the LORD.
verses.web: For there were many in the assembly who had not sanctified themselves: therefore the Levites were in charge of killing the Passovers for everyone who was not clean, to sanctify them to LORD.
verses.ct: Since many in the assembly hadn't consecrated themselves, the Levites took charge of slaughtering the Passover lambs on behalf of everyone who was ceremonially unclean, dedicating the offerings to the LORD.

verses.kjv: For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim, and Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet did they eat the passover otherwise than it was written. But Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, The good LORD pardon every one
verses.web: For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim, Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet they ate the Passover other than the way it is written. For Hezekiah had prayed for them, saying, “May the good LORD pardon everyone
verses.ct: A large number of people — especially many from Ephraim, Manasseh, Issachar, and Zebulun — hadn't purified themselves, yet they ate the Passover anyway, which wasn't how it was supposed to be done. But Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, "May the good LORD pardon everyone

verses.kjv: That prepareth his heart to seek God, the LORD God of his fathers, though he be not cleansed according to the purification of the sanctuary.
verses.web: who sets his heart to seek God, LORD, the God of his fathers, even if they aren’t clean according to the purification of the sanctuary.”
verses.ct: who has set their heart on seeking God — the LORD, the God of their ancestors — even if they aren't clean according to the sanctuary's rules of purification."

verses.kjv: And the LORD hearkened to Hezekiah, and healed the people.
verses.web: LORD listened to Hezekiah, and healed the people.
verses.ct: The LORD listened to Hezekiah and healed the people.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel that were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness: and the Levites and the priests praised the LORD day by day, singing with loud instruments unto the LORD.
verses.web: The children of Israel who were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness. The Levites and the priests praised LORD day by day, singing with loud instruments to LORD.
verses.ct: The Israelites who were in Jerusalem celebrated the Festival of Unleavened Bread for 7 days with tremendous joy. Every day, the Levites and priests praised the LORD, singing with powerful instruments to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah spake comfortably unto all the Levites that taught the good knowledge of the LORD: and they did eat throughout the feast seven days, offering peace offerings, and making confession to the LORD God of their fathers.
verses.web: Hezekiah spoke encouragingly to all the Levites who had good understanding in the service of LORD. So they ate throughout the feast for the seven days, offering sacrifices of peace offerings, and making confession to LORD, the God of their fathers.
verses.ct: Hezekiah spoke words of encouragement to all the Levites who showed great skill in serving the LORD. The people feasted for the full 7 days, offering peace offerings and giving thanks to the LORD, the God of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: And the whole assembly took counsel to keep other seven days: and they kept other seven days with gladness.
verses.web: The whole assembly took counsel to keep another seven days, and they kept another seven days with gladness.
verses.ct: The whole assembly then decided to celebrate for another 7 days, and they did — with great joy.

verses.kjv: For Hezekiah king of Judah did give to the congregation a thousand bullocks and seven thousand sheep; and the princes gave to the congregation a thousand bullocks and ten thousand sheep: and a great number of priests sanctified themselves.
verses.web: For Hezekiah king of Judah gave to the assembly for offerings one thousand bulls and seven thousand sheep; and the princes gave to the assembly a thousand bulls and ten thousand sheep: and a great number of priests sanctified themselves.
verses.ct: King Hezekiah contributed 1,000 bulls and 7,000 sheep for the assembly, and his officials donated another 1,000 bulls and 10,000 sheep. A great number of priests consecrated themselves for the occasion.

verses.kjv: And all the congregation of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and all the congregation that came out of Israel, and the strangers that came out of the land of Israel, and that dwelt in Judah, rejoiced.
verses.web: All the assembly of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and all the assembly who came out of Israel, and the foreigners who came out of the land of Israel, and who lived in Judah, rejoiced.
verses.ct: The entire assembly of Judah rejoiced — the priests, the Levites, all the people who had come from Israel, the foreigners who had traveled from the land of Israel, and those foreigners living in Judah.

verses.kjv: So there was great joy in Jerusalem: for since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel there was not the like in Jerusalem.
verses.web: So there was great joy in Jerusalem; for since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel there was nothing like this in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Jerusalem was filled with incredible joy. Nothing like this had happened in the city since the days of King Solomon, David's son.

verses.kjv: Then the priests the Levites arose and blessed the people: and their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to his holy dwelling place, even unto heaven.
verses.web: Then the Levitical priests arose and blessed the people. Their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to his holy habitation, even to heaven.
verses.ct: Then the Levitical priests stood and blessed the people. Their voices were heard, and their prayer rose up to God's holy dwelling place in heaven.
